title: 104_hr163
content: The Act titled "Social Security Decedent's Family Relief Act of 1995" allows for the continuation of benefits through the month of the beneficiary's death. The Social Security Act is amended to adjust Old-Age Insurance Benefits and Wife's Insurance Benefits, including changes to the month of eligibility and redesignating subparagraphs. Conforming amendments are also made to ensure consistency in the Act. The Social Security Act is amended to adjust Husband's and Child's Insurance Benefits, including changes to eligibility months and redesignating subparagraphs for consistency. The Social Security Act is amended to adjust Widow's and Widower's Insurance Benefits, including changes to eligibility months and redesignating subparagraphs for consistency. The Social Security Act is amended to adjust Widow's and Widower's Insurance Benefits, including changes to eligibility months and redesignating subparagraphs for consistency. Amendments include adjustments to Mother's and Father's Insurance Benefits, as well as Parent's Insurance Benefits regarding remarriage and death. The Social Security Act is amended to adjust various insurance benefits, including disability, benefits at age 72 for uninsured individuals, and changes related to parent's remarriage and death. SEC. 3. COMPUTATION AND PAYMENT OF LAST MONTHLY PAYMENT. Amends Section 202 of the Social Security Act to address termination of last monthly insurance benefit due to death. The text discusses the calculation of an individual's monthly insurance benefit under the Social Security Act in the event of their death. The benefit amount is determined based on a fraction of the days in the month before the individual's death. This calculation applies after all other adjustments to the benefit have been made. The Social Security Act is amended to include a new subsection for Disability Insurance Benefits in section 223. The Social Security Act is amended to include a new subsection for Disability Insurance Benefits in section 223. Last Payment of Benefit Terminated by Death. The Social Security Act is amended to include a new subsection for Disability Insurance Benefits in section 223. The amount of an individual's monthly benefit paid for the month of their death is calculated based on a fraction of days in that month. This provision applies after all other adjustments to the benefit have been made. Benefits at Age 72 for Certain Uninsured Individuals are amended in the Social Security Act. The last payment of benefits is adjusted upon an individual's death, calculated based on the days in the month before the death. This adjustment applies after all other benefit adjustments have been made. Payment is made according to section 204(d) of the Social Security Act. SEC. 4. DISREGARD OF BENEFIT FOR MONTH OF DEATH UNDER FAMILY MAXIMUM PROVISIONS. Amends the Social Security Act to disregard the benefit payable for the month of the insured individual's death. SEC. 5. EFFECTIVE DATE. The amendments apply to deaths occurring after the enactment of this Act.
